author: Gregor Stuart Hunter
title: Global Stocks Struggle After Bad Month
text:
U.S. stocks fell Thursday, even as Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell brushed back concerns that inflation is accelerating so fast the central bank would have to aggressively respond.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average declined 151 points, or 0.6%, to 24879 in recent trading after rising more than 150 points earlier in the session. The S&P 500 dropped 0.5%, and the Nasdaq Composite also slid 0.5%, as all three indexes were on pace for their first day of gains in three sessions.
